Papua New Guinea is known as the land of
the unexpected you really do feel like
you're stepping back in time in a way
though you know you you can be in the
highlands and then feel like there's
best first contact
it's that remote it's it's that way off
the beaten track what's so fascinating
about New Guinea is that clash of
modernization of of the West against the
Stone Age of ascent and that's what I've
been drawn to him as a photographer I've
been drawn to covering society and
looking at that clash of cultures August
23 2011 the sea pick is the heart and
soul of PNG along with the Highlands
missing out on the sea people would be
like going to Brazzaville and not going
up the Congo River
ever since I picked up a camera
essentially I made Diaries I wrote
Diaries the diaries have sort of
progressed in a way they've gone from
just plain old handwritten Diaries to
more art books so I'm now sketching and
I'm putting in clippings and making
collages and they become very much a
part of my entire body of work September
15 2011 bird of paradise hotel Goroka
room 2 1 - every town in PNG feels like
a border town they all seem to have this
frontier feeling transit places people
coming and going and edgy kind of vibe
and life to it
a rascal is a criminal
the whole gang thing is quite new I mean
it's not something that has been around
for a long time it's something that grew
out of urbanization 80% unemployment I
don't know anywhere in the world that
has that kind of figure for unemployment
the conditions of that society the
poverty the unemployment has forced
these people into crime
from the sea peak we took the Blackwater
River the water is so dark and chocolate
in color it's almost black reflecting
the sky and clouds and the approaching
foothills of the Highlands balance the
tribal gatherings in the highlands
they're called sing sings essentially
they're cultural festivals for housands
of different tribes coming together from
all over to compete for fame and glory
it's Stone Age Woodstock it's wild I've
developed a kind of I guess a style in
my portraiture worth using a black sheet
for color and a white sheet my black and
white work my portrait becomes more of
an environmental portrait it's it's
including what's going on around the
frame it's not just about the subject of
the sitter I feel grateful more than
anything that I'm allowed to go in and
capture these moments because you don't
take pictures you know you're given
pictures it's a gift
